question: What is one potential benefit of using a test automation tool?

options.A: The quality of defects will improve
options.B: Ease of access to statistics about test progress
options.C: Disk space is not required to track versions of test artifacts
options.D: Less network traffic generated

question: Which of the following is a benefit of early stakeholder feedback?

options.A: It can be gathered early and then used to make changes after the product goes to production to make it more user friendly
options.B: It allows the project manager to get a better view of the changes that will be needed for the next version
options.C: The developers get a better understanding of what they are building
options.D: The testers get a better understanding of the test automation requirements

question: Which of the following is a good testing practice that applies regardless of the specific software development lifecycle being used?

options.A: Prompt and prepared attendance to stand-up meetings
options.B: Step-by-step test case documentation
options.C: Ensuring there is a corresponding testing activity for every software development activity
options.D: Involving the stakeholders in reviewing all acceptance criteria prior to designing test cases

question: In an Agile development model, the completion of testing or “done” is defined by which of the following?

options.A: Project management
options.B: Entry criteria
options.C: Exit criteria
options.D: The expected test completion date

question: You are testing web application software that allows a person to use their travel points to make flight and hotel reservations.

options.A: Points > Reservation
options.B: Login > Points, Points > Flight, Points > Hotel
options.C: Login > Login, Login > Points, Login > Flight, Login > Hotel, Points > Flight, Points > Hotel
options.D: Login > Login, Login > Points, Login > Flight, Login > Hotel, Flight > Hotel, Hotel > Flight, Flight > Login, Hotel > Login

question: Which of the following is an advantage of the whole team approach?

options.A: Any person in the team with the right skills can perform any task
options.B: Tasks are assigned to specific team members who will own that task until completion
options.C: Testers have clear ownership of quality and this eliminates confusion and overlap
options.D: Business representatives are not included in the team so they can supply independent assessment during UAT

question: If you are using test results to learn more about the software and are then creating additional tests based on those results, what type of testing are you doing?

options.A: Exploratory
options.B: Decision-based
options.C: Checklist-based
options.D: Control flow

question: You are working on calculating the estimation for a project. You have been given the following numbers by your manager, who is considered to be an expert in estimation:

options.A: E is 46.3 days, SD = 35
options.B: E is 40 days, SD = 6.67
options.C: E is 37.3 days, SD = 43.3
options.D: E is 43.3 days, SD = 5

question: Which black-box technique should be used to verify different responses of the system, depending on its current conditions or previous history?

options.A: Use case testing
options.B: Decision table testing
options.C: State transition testing
options.D: Equivalence partitioning

question: You have been given the following story:

options.A: The security test case should be executed first as it is related to access control
options.B: The test cases should contain all steps required for execution, including navigation information and SQL statements required to perform the verification
options.C: The test cases are not being executed in the proper order
options.D: The test cases do not indicate the expected result

question: In what way does configuration management help the tester?

options.A: It verifies that the test cases are executed in the correct order
options.B: It ensures that regressions do not occur
options.C: It enforces proper unit testing and measurement
options.D: It uniquely identifies the items to be tested

question: If you are responsible for test analysis and test design what is your primary role in your team?

options.A: Business analyst
options.B: Test manager
options.C: Developer
options.D: Tester

question: A functional requirement states that pressure values must always be positive and stay within a range of 100 to 200 pounds for a particular tank (100 and 200 are valid within the range).

options.A: A series of tests where pressure is set to 98, 110, and 201 pounds
options.B: A series of tests where pressure is set to 98, 100, and 200 pounds
options.C: A series of tests where pressure is set to 100, 110, and 200 pounds
options.D: A series of tests where pressure is set to -1, 0, 175, and 297 pounds

question: You have been given the following test cases for execution. You have been told that security and usability are the highest priorities respectively for this banking application. What is the proper execution order for these test cases?
When is the detailed risk analysis for a story first conducted?

options.A: Project planning
options.B: Iteration planning
options.C: Release planning
options.D: Epic planning

question: When tests are being created to achieve statement coverage, what are they exercising?

options.A: Only the decisions in the code
options.B: Only the loops in the code
options.C: Only the executable statements in the code
options.D: All lines of code including executable statements and comments

question: You have just completed a retrospective at the end of a sprint. One of the developers raised an issue with defect reports not containing information about the configuration, data, and system being used when the failure occurred. When this happens, they reject the defect report and the tester has to update it and send it again. This sometimes takes three or four iterations to get all the information on the report. The test team will take this feedback and will improve the details included in the defect reports.

options.A: Increased test effectiveness / efficiency
options.B: Team bonding and learning
options.C: Improved quality of the test basis
options.D: Increased quality of the test cases

question: What is a reasonable way to control and minimize the cost of testing and development?

options.A: Conduct formal reviews to detect defects as early as possible.
options.B: Perform a usability analysis prior to user interface design.
options.C: Automate error detection at the beginning of acceptance testing.
options.D: Hire low-cost, outsourced testing staff for system testing.

question: Which of the following is a technique that can be used to develop user stories in collaboration with the developers and business?

options.A: DevOps
options.B: CI/CD
options.C: Brainstorming
options.D: Equivalence Partitioning

question: Which is a key function of a test management tool?

options.A: Facilitates management and control of testing activities
options.B: Generates test data based on test management criteria
options.C: Generates detailed test specifications based on the test plan
options.D: Analyzes and enforces coding and testing standards

question: Which of the following best suggests the need for maintenance testing?

options.A: Failures found in alpha testing
options.B: The initial release of the software
options.C: Changing requirements during pre-deployment activities
options.D: Adding a new feature to an existing system

question: Which of the following should you review using static testing?

options.A: Memory leak during execution
options.B: Performance of a module under load
options.C: Interactive output from a debugger
options.D: Test plan

question: Which of the following is supported by good information traceability?

options.A: Portability of test automation code
options.B: Understandability of test reports
options.C: Dependability of test environments
options.D: Stability of the system under test

question: Which of the following is a methodical approach to error guessing?

options.A: Create a list of possible failures and defects and design tests to address each one
options.B: Ask the developers where the likely errors will be and discuss how to test for each one
options.C: Review the code to determine areas of high complexity and target those areas with tests
options.D: Determine all the decisions in the code and design tests to address each one

question: Given the following requirement:

options.A: Functional
options.B: Reliability
options.C: Performance
options.D: Maintainability

question: How is branch coverage determined?

options.A: By taking the number of branches in the code that have been tested and dividing that by the number of total branches in the code
options.B: By taking the number of branches in the code on one path that has been tested and dividing that number by the total paths through the code
options.C: By taking the number of statements in the code and dividing those by the number of branches that have been tested
options.D: By counting the number of branches in the code that have been tested

question: You are using boundary value analysis to determine your test data.

You are working with a geographically and time zone distributed team. It is important that the entire team always have access to the latest test execution information. Which of these is the most appropriate method for communicating that status?

options.A: Daily stand-up meetings with everyone
options.B: Dashboards connected to the test management and defect management systems that automatically update when a change is made
options.C: Email sent out hourly to all team members with red text for any new issues with a “must read” note in the subject line
options.D: Formal test reports issued each week with trend charts and residual defect status information

question: During which activity in the review process are the quality characteristics selected for evaluation?

options.A: Initiating
options.B: Planning
options.C: Analysis
options.D: Fixing

question: Which testing principle provides a good reason to base testing upon risk mitigation priorities?

options.A: Testing shows the presence of defects
options.B: Exhaustive testing is impossible
options.C: Tests wear out
options.D: Defects tend to cluster in a few modules

question: Which of the following is a correct statement regarding Quadrant Q2 of the testing quadrants?

options.A: It is technology facing, supports the team, and contains component and component integration tests
options.B: It is business facing, critiques the product, and contains exploratory and usability testing
options.C: It is technology facing, critiques the product, and contains the smoke tests and performance tests
options.D: It is business facing, supports the team, and contains functional tests and API tests

question: Which of the following provides two defined risk response actions to help control product risk?

options.A: Deny risk, Mitigate risk by testing
options.B: Accept risk, Abandon risk
options.C: Abandon risk, Delay risk
options.D: Transfer risk, Accept risk

question: Your company has been working in a waterfall lifecycle model. They have now decided to implement DevOps and will be using CI/CD. Which of the following is a change that will be required from the testing team?

options.A: No change is required. The current approach will still be applicable.
options.B: There will be additional emphasis on test automation to supply continuous testing.
options.C: Additional time will be needed to analyze the requirements and design test cases.
options.D: There will be a need for less technical testers because the developers will handle all the technical testing.

question: Testing can be seen as a destructive activity. Which of the following generic skills will help a tester overcome this barrier?

options.A: Analytical thinking
options.B: Communicating with empathy
options.C: Curiosity
options.D: Tool knowledge

question: If a developer is analyzing a failure to determine the cause, he is engaging in what type of activity?

options.A: Testing
options.B: Design and Analysis
options.C: Debugging
options.D: Configuration management

question: If test cases are written in the given/when/then format, what type of test-first software development is being used?

options.A: Test-driven development
options.B: Acceptance test-driven development
options.C: Business-driven development
options.D: Behavior-driven development

question: Which of the following is a valid test objective?

options.A: Finding the stable areas of the code which do not require testing
options.B: Debugging incidents to determine the cause of the problem
options.C: Finding failures and defects in the test object
options.D: Participating in code reviews to improve scripting skills

question: You are a functional tester, performing system testing of a flight reservation application. After logging into the system, you selected the “New Reservation” option on the main menu, and clicked the “Submit” button without making any changes to the default values on the screen.

options.A: The test environment in which the test was executed
options.B: Test case expected results
options.C: The name of the developer who should have caught their error in unit testing
options.D: Frequency of occurrence

question: Which of the following is an example of a test work product?

options.A: Test plan
options.B: Test platform selection
options.C: Code base
options.D: Test tool selection

question: You are getting ready to test software that will be used to dispatch spa pool technicians. You have decided to use a decision table to determine when chemicals will be needed and when maintenance functions should be performed. You have been given the following requirements:

options.A: 1 is correct
options.B: 2 is correct
options.C: 3 is correct
options.D: 4 is correct

question: You have been given the following story:

options.A: The security test case should be executed first as it is related to access control
options.B: The test cases are not accepting the test criteria
options.C: The test cases are not being executed in the proper order
options.D: The test cases do not indicate the expected result

question: Which of the following provides two defined risk response actions to help control product risk?

options.A: Deny risk, Cancel risk
options.B: Accept risk, Abandon risk
options.C: Abandon risk, Delay risk
options.D: Transfer risk, Accept risk

question: A typical objective of testing is to:

options.A: Determine the most appropriate level of detail with which to design test cases.
options.B: Verify the compliance of the test object with regulatory requirements.
options.C: Plan test activities in accordance with the existing test policy and test strategy.
options.D: Verify the correct creation and configuration of the test environment.

question: Exploratory testing is an experience-based test technique:

options.A: Where a developer and a tester work together on the same workstation: while the developer actively writes code, the tester explores the code to find defects.
options.B: That can be organized into sessions guided by test charters outlining test objectives that will guide the testers' exploration.
options.C: Where a team of testers explores all possible test techniques in order to determine the most suitable combination of these techniques to apply for a test project.
options.D: That aims at finding defects by designing tests that exercise all possible combinations of input values and preconditions.

question: Which of the following is an advantage of the whole team approach?

options.A: It helps avoid the risk of tasks associated with a user story not moving through the Agile task board at an acceptable rate during an iteration.
options.B: It helps team members understand the current status of an iteration by visualizing the amount of work left to do compared to the time allotted for the iteration.
options.C: It helps the whole team be more effective in test case design by requiring all team members to master all types of test techniques.
options.D: It helps team members develop better relationships with each other and make their collaboration more effective for the benefit of the Project.

question: Which of the following statements about checklist-based testing is TRUE?

options.A: Checklist-based testing is a technique for managing the review meeting that can be applied in those reviews where the use of checklists is mandatory, as is often the case in formal reviews.
options.B: Checklist-based testing is a review technique that can be used in a formal review process where reviewers, during individual review, try to detect issues within the work product based on a checklist.
options.C: In checklist-based testing, using checklists at a high level of detail is more likely to produce test cases that are easier to reproduce than those using checklists at a low level of detail.
options.D: Checklists used in checklist-based testing should be reviewed periodically for updates as, over time, test cases designed using the same checklist may become less effective at finding defects.

question: An application is subjected to a constant load for an extended period of time as part of a performance test. While running this test, the response time of the application steadily slows down, which results in a requirement not being met. This slowdown is caused by a memory leak where the application code does not properly release some of the dynamically allocated memory when it is no longer needed. Which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.A: The slowdown is a failure while the memory leak is a defect.
options.B: The slowdown is a defect while the memory leak is an error.
options.C: The slowdown is an error, the memory leak is a defect.
options.D: The slowdown is a defect; the memory leak is a failure.

question: Which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.A: User acceptance tests are usually automated and aim to verify the acceptance criteria for user stories.
options.B: Acceptance criteria for user stories can include details on data definitions, for example by describing the format, allowed values, and default values for a data item.
options.C: Acceptance criteria for user stories should focus on positive scenarios, while negative scenarios should be excluded.
options.D: Tests derived from acceptance criteria for user stories are not included in any of the four testing quadrants.

question: In addition to thorough testing of the requirements specification, a development team aims to involve users as early as possible in the development process, using practices such as prototyping, to ensure that the software systems being developed will meet the users’ expectations. This approach is especially useful at mitigating the risks associated with one of the seven testing principles, which one?

options.A: Tests wear out.
options.B: Absence-of-errors fallacy.
options.C: Working software over comprehensive documentation.
options.D: Defects cluster together.

question: A requirement specifies that a certain identifier (ID) must be between 5 and 10 characters long, must contain only alphanumeric characters, and its first character must be a letter. As a tester, you want to apply one-dimensional equivalence partitioning to test this ID. This means that you have to apply equivalence partitioning individually: to the length of the ID, the type of characters contained within the ID, and the type of the first character of the ID. What is the number of partitions to cover?
Determining the schedule for each testing activity and test milestones for a test project, using activity estimates, available resources, and other constraints is a typical task performed during:

options.A: Test execution.
options.B: Test design.
options.C: Test analysis.
options.D: Test planning.

question: A requirement specifies that if the total amount of sales (TAS) made during the year by a corporate seller is 300,000€ or more, the bonus that must be paid to the seller is 100% of a certain amount agreed upon at the beginning of the year. The software contains a fault as it implements this requirement with the decision "IF (TAS = 300,000)" instead of "IF (TAS >= 300,000)". The application of the 3-value boundary value analysis to this problem consists of the following three test cases (TAS is an integer variable):

options.A: TC1 would highlight the fault.
options.B: TC2 would highlight the fault.
options.C: TC3 would highlight the fault.
options.D: None of the three test cases would highlight the fault.

question: A document describes the test procedures that have been derived for the identified test sets. Among other things, the order in which the test cases in the corresponding test set are to be executed according to the dependencies described by preconditions and postconditions is specified. This document is a typical work product produced as part of:

options.A: Test design.
options.B: Test analysis.
options.C: Test implementation.
options.D: Test monitoring and control.

question: Which of the following types of tools is BEST suited for determining source code compliance with the guidelines provided by a coding standard?

options.A: Containerization tool.
options.B: Fault seeding tool.
options.C: Static analysis tool.
options.D: Test data preparation tool.

question: Which of the following statements about traceability is FALSE?

options.A: Traceability between test basis items and the test cases designed to cover them, makes it possible to determine which test basis items have been covered by the executed test cases.
options.B: Traceability between test basis items and the test cases designed to cover them, enables experience-based test techniques to be applied.
options.C: Traceability between test basis items and the test cases designed to cover them, enables identification of which test cases will be affected by changes to the test basis items.
options.D: Traceability can be established and maintained through all the test documentation for a given test level, such as from test conditions through test cases to test scripts.

question: Which of the following is a typical potential risk of using test automation tools?

options.A: Reduced feedback times regarding software quality compared to manual testing.
options.B: Reduced test execution times compared to manual testing.
options.C: Reduced repeatability and consistency of tests compared to manual testing.
options.D: Underestimation of effort required to maintain test scripts.

question: A typical generic skill required for the role of tester is the ability to:

options.A: Take on the role of developer to meet challenging project deadlines.
options.B: Assume leadership aimed at imposing decisions on the rest of the team.
options.C: Use tools to make the execution of repetitive testing tasks more efficient.
options.D: Determine the corrective actions to get a test project on track in case of deviations from the test plan.

question: As a tester, as part of a V-model project, you are currently executing some tests aimed at verifying if a mobile app asks the user to grant the proper access permissions during the installation process and after the installation process. The requirements specification states that in both cases the app shall ask the user to grant access permissions only to the camera and photos stored on the device. However, you observe that the app also asks the user to grant access permission to all contacts on the device. Consider the following items:

options.A: [I] and [II].
options.B: [II] and [III].
options.C: [II], [III] and [V].
options.D: [I], [IV] and [V].

question: Which of the following statements refers to a good testing practice that applies to all software development lifecycles?

options.A: Each test level should have its own specific test objectives that should be consistent with the software development lifecycle phase or type of activities it addresses.
options.B: Test analysis and design for any test levels should begin as soon as coding is complete, and all system components are available for testing.
options.C: The most efficient and effective method of conveying information to and within a development team is face-to-face conversation.
options.D: All the tests should be automated and run as part of the continuous integration process with every software change.

question: The following decision table is used to assist a doctor in determining the drug therapy to prescribe for a patient (aged 6 to 65 years) diagnosed with acute sinusitis. The table consists of three Boolean conditions and six actions:

options.A: Column 7 represents an impossible situation and thus can be deleted.
options.B: Columns 1 and 3 can be merged into a single column.
options.C: Columns 2, 4, 6 and 8 can be merged into a single column.
options.D: Columns 5 and 7 can be merged into a single column.

question: Which of the following statements about TDD, BDD and ATDD is TRUE?

options.A: Refactoring is a practice that is an integral part of TDD and is applied both to tests and to code written to satisfy those tests.
options.B: ATDD is a black-box test design technique that is applicable exclusively at acceptance test level.
options.C: BDD is a developer practice where business stakeholders are not usually involved as the tests are directly written at unit/component test level.
options.D: ATDD is the practice of running the automated acceptance tests as part of a continuous integration process.

question: An anti-intrusion system is battery powered and is activated by pressing the only available button. To deactivate the system, the operator must enter a PIN code. The system will stay in alert mode within a configurable timeout and an alarm bell will ring if the system is not deactivated before the timeout expires. The following state transition diagram describes the behavior of the system:
Which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.A: Unlike functional testing, non-functional testing can only be applied to conventional systems, not artificial intelligence-based system.
options.B: Functional testing focuses on what the system is supposed to do, while white-box testing focuses on how well the system does what it is supposed to do.
options.C: Functional testing can be applied to all test levels, while non-functional testing can be applied only to system and acceptance test levels.
options.D: Black-box test techniques and experience-based test techniques may be applicable to both functional testing and non-functional testing.

question: Consider the following user story about an e-commerce website's registration feature that only allows registered users to make purchases:

options.A: The new user enters valid values in the fields of the registration form, except for the email address, where he/she enters an e-mail address provided by a free online mail service that allow to create disposable email addresses. Then he/she is informed by the website about this issue.
options.B: The new user enters valid values in the fields of the registration form, except for the first name, where he/she enters a first name with 10 characters that contains a number. Then he/she is informed by the website about this issue.
options.C: The user accesses the website with a username and password, and successfully places a purchase order for five items, paying by Mastercard credit card.
options.D: The new user enters valid values in all the fields of the registration form, confirms to accept all the terms and conditions, submits the registration request and then receives an e-mail containing the confirmation link to the e-mail address specified in the registration form.

question: After being in operation for many years, a document management system must be decommissioned as it has reached its end of life. This system will not be replaced by any other new system. A legal obligation provides that all documents within the system must be kept for at least 20 years in a state archive. Which of the following statements about maintenance testing for decommissioning of this system is TRUE?

options.A: No maintenance testing is required as this system will not be replaced.
options.B: Data migration testing is required as part of maintenance testing.
options.C: Confirmation testing is required as part of maintenance testing.
options.D: Regression testing is required as part of maintenance testing.

question: Which of the following statements about the test pyramid is TRUE?

options.A: Each layer of the test pyramid groups tests related to a single non-functional quality characteristic.
options.B: The higher the layer of the test pyramid, the more production code a single automated test within the layer tends to cover.
options.C: The higher the layer of the test pyramid, the more maintainable a single automated test within the layer tends to be.
options.D: The higher the layer of the test pyramid, the more isolated a single automated test within the layer tends to be.

question: Which of the following statements about retrospectives is TRUE?

options.A: Only developers and testers should be involved in retrospectives, as involving people in other roles is very likely to prevent developers and testers from having open and constructive discussions that really help identify process improvements.
options.B: Retrospectives can be very effective in identifying process improvements and can also be very efficient and cost-effective especially since, unlike reviews, they do not require any follow-up activities.
options.C: On Agile projects, well-conducted retrospectives at the end of each iteration can help the team reduce and sometimes even eliminate the need for daily stand-up meetings.
options.D: During retrospectives, in addition to identifying relevant process improvements, participants should also consider how to implement these improvements and retain them based on the context of the project, such as the software development lifecycle.

question: Which of the following about typical information found within a test plan is FALSE?

options.A: The need to temporarily have additional test personnel available for specific test phases and/or test activities.
options.B: The conditions that must be met in order for the test execution activities to be considered completed.
options.C: The list of the product risks which have not been fully mitigated at the end of test execution.
options.D: The conditions that must be met for part of all the planned activities to be suspended and resumed.

question: Which of the following statements about the shift-left approach is FALSE?

options.A: The shift-left approach can only be implemented with test automation.
options.B: The shift-left approach in testing is compatible with DevOps practices.
options.C: The shift-left approach can involve security vulnerabilities.
options.D: The shift-left approach can be supported by static analysis tools.

question: Which of the following statements about the testing quadrants is TRUE?

options.A: The higher the number of the testing quadrant, the more important the tests associated with this quadrant are.
options.B: Automated acceptance tests produced during BDD and ATDD are classified in quadrant Q2.
options.C: Exploratory tests are classified in quadrant Q3, and they are usually included in a continuous integration process.
options.D: Automated unit tests produced during TDD are classified in quadrant Q4 as they are technology facing.

question: Which of the following is a role that is usually responsible for documenting the findings (e.g., action items, decisions, recommendations) made by the review team as part of a typical formal review?

options.A: Review leader.
options.B: Facilitator.
options.C: Recorder.
options.D: Moderator.

question: Consider the following examples of risks identified in different software development projects:

options.A: [II] and [IV] are product risks; [I] and [III] are project risks.
options.B: [II] and [III] are product risks; [I] and [IV] are project risks.
options.C: [I], and [IV] are product risks; [II] and [III] are project risks.
options.D: [I], [II] and [III] are product risks; [IV] is a project risk.

question: Which of the following is a factor that contributes to a successful review?

options.A: All participants in the review are aware they will be evaluated based on the defects they will find.
options.B: The author of the work product to be reviewed leads the review meeting.
options.C: All participants in the review are trained to deal with the review type and its objectives.
options.D: Review metrics must be collected to improve the review process.

question: A test status report SHOULD:

options.A: Specify the impediments to carrying out the planned test activities in the reporting period and the corresponding solutions put in place to remove them.
options.B: Be produced as part of test completion activities and report unmitigated product risks to support the decision whether or not to release the product.
options.C: Always be based on the same template within an organization, as its structure and contents should not be affected by the audience to which the report is presented.
options.D: Specify the lines of communication between testing, other lifecycle activities, and within the organization that were chosen at the outset of the test project.

question: Which of the following statements about static testing and dynamic testing is TRUE?

options.A: Static testing is better suited than dynamic testing for highlighting issues that could indicate inappropriate code modularization.
options.B: Dynamic testing can only be applied to executable work products, while static testing can only be applied to non-executable work products.
options.C: Both dynamic testing and static testing cause failures, but failures caused by static testing are usually easier and cheaper to analyze.
options.D: Security vulnerabilities can only be detected when the software is being executed, and thus they can only be detected through dynamic testing, not through static testing.

question: From a testing perspective, configuration management:

options.A: Allows the expected results to be compared with the actual results.
options.B: Allows the tracking of all changes to versions of the testware.
options.C: Includes all activities that direct and control an organization with regard to quality.
options.D: Focuses on configuring static analysis tools to choose the most suitable breadth and depth of analysis.

question: Which of the following statements about the typical activities of a formal review process is TRUE?

options.A: Individual review is only mandatory when the size of the work product under review is too large to cover at the review meeting.
options.B: Various review techniques that may be applied by participants during individual review are described in the ISO/IEC/IEEE 29119-3 standard.
options.C: Choosing which standards to follow during the review process is usually made during review planning.
options.D: One of the main goals of the review meeting is to make sure that all participants are aware of their roles and responsibilities in the review process.

question: Consider an estimation session in which a six-member Agile team (Mempb1, ..., Memb6) uses the planning poker technique to estimate a user story (in story points). The team members will use a set of cards with the following values: 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21. Below is the outcome of the first round of estimation for this session:

options.A: The final estimate of the user story in story points is determined by applying the three-point estimation technique with the following input values: most optimistic estimate = 1, most likely estimate = 3, and most pessimistic estimate = 21.
options.B: Further estimation rounds should be performed until all team members will pick the card having the same value: this value will represent the final estimate of the user story in story points.
options.C: The final estimate of the user story in story points is determined by calculating the average value between the most optimistic estimate of 21 story points (Memb4) and the most pessimistic estimate of 1 story point (Memb6).
options.D: Memb6 and Memb4 which have produced the most pessimistic and the most optimistic estimates respectively, should explain the reasons of their choices to stimulate a discussion between all members before proceeding to another estimation round.

question: Which of the following answers describes a reason for adopting experience-based testing techniques?

options.A: Experience-based test techniques provide more systematic coverage criteria than black-box and white-box test techniques.
options.B: Experience-based test techniques completely rely on the tester’s past experience for designing test cases.
options.C: Experience-based test techniques allow designing test cases that are usually easier to reproduce than those designed with black-box and white-box test techniques.
options.D: Experience-based test techniques tend to find defects that may be difficult to find with black-box and white-box test techniques and are often useful to complement these more systematic techniques.

question: For each test case to be executed, the following table specifies its dependencies and the required configuration of the test environment for running such test case:

options.A: TC4, TC3, TC2, TC1, TC5.
options.B: TC1, TC5, TC4, TC3, TC2.
options.C: TC4, TC3, TC2, TC5, TC1.
options.D: TC4, TC1, TC5, TC2, TC3.

question: Which of the following statements about white-box testing is FALSE?

options.A: Static testing can benefit from using code-related white-box test techniques during code reviews.
options.B: White-box testing allows suggesting test cases for increasing coverage levels which are based on objective measures.
options.C: Achieving full code coverage for a component or a system ensures that it has been fully tested.
options.D: Black-box testing can benefit from using code-related white-box test techniques to increase confidence in the code.

question: Which of the following statements about statement coverage is TRUE?

options.A: Achieving 90% statement coverage ensures that 90% branch coverage is achieved.
options.B: Achieving 100% statement coverage ensures that no variable within the code has been used without being initialized.
options.C: Achieving 100% statement coverage ensures that 100% branch coverage is achieved.
options.D: Achieving 80% statement coverage ensures that 80% of all executable statements within the code have been exercised.

question: The following decision table is an excerpt of a larger decision table used to assist a doctor in determining the drug therapy to prescribe for a patient (aged 6 to 65 years) diagnosed with acute sinusitis. The table consists of four Boolean conditions and six actions:

An anti-intrusion system is battery powered and is activated by pressing the only available button. To deactivate the system, the operator must enter a PIN code. The system will stay in alert mode within a configurable timeout and an alarm bell will ring if the system is not deactivated before the timeout expires. The following state transition diagram describes the behavior of the system:

options.A: “Inactive”, [Press Button], “Active”, [Sensor Activated], “Alert Mode”, [Timeout expired], “Alarm bell rings”
options.B: “Inactive”, [Enter PIN], “Active”, [Sensor Activated], “Alert Mode”, [Timeout expired], “Alarm bell rings”
options.C: “Inactive”, [Press Button], “Active”, [Press Button], “Active”, [Sensor Activated], “Alert Mode”, [Timeout expired], “Alarm bell rings”
options.D: “Inactive”, [Press Button], “Active”, [Sensor Activated], “Alert Mode”, [Press Button], “Alert Mode”, [Timeout expired], “Alarm bell rings”

question: Consider the following test-related items (1, 2, 3, 4) and four testing quadrants (Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4):

You are a tester working on a critical project. Based on the risk analysis you need to decide on the order of test execution. Which of the following lists the correct sequence of test execution? Priority 1 is the highest and Priority 3 is the lowest priority.

options.A: D-С-В-A
options.B: C-B-A-D
options.C: D-A-B-C
options.D: D-B-A-C

question: You are a test manager responsible for implementing risk-based testing in your organization which deals with software in the healthcare domain. You are writing a handbook of various product risk mitigation options. Which ONE of the following options correctly represent the correct mitigation options?

options.A: Choosing a tool for automated unit testing to reduce the risks
options.B: Using a third-party testing company to transfer the risk to that company
options.C: Selecting a tester with required knowledge related to compliance and standards
options.D: Increasing the number of testers to be able to take care of all the risks

question: Which of the following statements about impact of DevOps on testing is CORRECT?

options.A: DevOps helps shift focus of operations people to functional testing
options.B: DevOps helps shift focus of testing people to perform operations testing
options.C: DevOps helps eliminate manual testing by having focus on continuous automated testing
options.D: DevOps helps bring focus on testing of non-functional characteristics

question: Which sequence of state transitions is INCORRECT in accordance with the following description?

options.A: A is active and В is inactive A goes down. В becomes active then В goes down. A is made active
options.B: A comes up when В is active and A was down Now A becomes active and В becomes inactive
options.C: A is active and В is inactive then A goes down В becomes active
options.D: A and В are both down then A and В both come back up at the same time A should become the active system and В should be inactive

question: In a review which of the following is the responsibility of the manager?

options.A: Performing detailed review based on past experience
options.B: Organizing the logistics of the review meeting
options.C: Ensuring that sufficient time is available for review
options.D: Measuring the performance of each reviewer

question: What does the "absence-of-defects fallacy" refer to in software development?

options.A: The idea that fixing defects is NOT important to meeting user needs
options.B: The need for constant system quality assurance and improvements.
options.C: A misconception that software verification is unnecessary
options.D: The belief that thoroughly testing all requirements guarantees system success

question: Given some statements about independence of testing

options.A: ii and iv
options.B: iii and iv
options.C: i and iii
options.D: i and iv

question: In branch testing, what is the significance of a conditional branch in a software program?

options.A: It signifies a comment or documentation within the code and it doesn’t indicate a defect
options.B: It marks a point where the program’s execution will terminate bringing the program to a halt
options.C: It indicates a decision point where the program can follow different paths based on specific conditions
options.D: It represents a programming error and therefore a conditional branch should be avoided

question: For a given set of test-cases, which of the following is a benefit of running these tests with a test automation tool?

options.A: Test coverage is increased
options.B: The time spent on repetitive tasks is reduced
options.C: The number of found bugs is reduced
options.D: The total cost of the test project always decreases

question: Which of the following statements is CORRECT about the value added by a tester to release planning?

options.A: The tester writes acceptance criteria
options.B: The tester assesses the testability of the user stories
options.C: The tester breaks down user stories into smaller testing tasks
options.D: The tester estimates the testing effort for individual iterations

question: Which of the following statements correctly describe the business facing quadrant that supports the team?

options.A: It is the quadrant that component testing.
options.B: It is the quadrant that Non-functional testing such as performance and the tests are created on the basis of user scenarios
options.C: It is the quadrant that deals with tests created on the basis of user stories
options.D: Exploratory tests are generally used for this quadrant

question: Which ONE of the following is a characteristic of exploratory testing?

options.A: Testing without defined time-boxes
options.B: Usually conducted when there is sufficient time for testing
options.C: Test cases are written once the specifications become available
options.D: Effectiveness depends on the individual testers’ skills

question: Pariksha labs is a mature software testing company. They are TMMi level 5 certified. Their testing processes are well defined. Which ONE of the following statements is likely to be CORRECT about them?

options.A: They try to perform 100% automation for every project because automation is a must for efficiency
options.B: Same set of testing processes are used by them without needing any tweaks because that is the hallmark of a mature testing company
options.C: The company uses same test strategy for all the projects doing minor changes based on test manager responsible for the project because their test strategy template is very mature and do not need to change
options.D: The question about the test design techniques to be used is determined based on various factors such as the domain and expectations of the stakeholders

question: You are working on creating test cases for a user story.

options.A: Logon to the site and book an exam for the 8 AM (GMT) timeslot. Expected result: You should get 10% discounted price. Change the time to any other timeslot. Expected result: Discount should be removed.
options.B: Logon to the site. Book an exam for the current date. Expected result: timeslots should be shown. Change the time to any other date prior to the selected date. Expected result: New slot should become visible.
options.C: Logon to the site. Book 5 exams for the current date. Expected result: Exams should be booked. Book 6th timeslot for the same date. Expected result: The exam should be booked but no discount should be given.
options.D: Logon to the site. Expected result: Default 8 AM (GMT) timeslot should be selected. Change the time to any other timeslot Expected result. New slot should be booked.

question: A number of characteristics are given for impact of SDLC on the testing effort.

options.A: i, ii and iii are characteristics of sequential models; iv and v are characteristics of iterative and incremental models
options.B: iii and iv are characteristics of sequential models; and i, ii and v are characteristics of iterative and incremental models
options.C: i and iv are characteristics of sequential models; ii, iii and v are characteristics of iterative and incremental models
options.D: ii and iv are characteristics of sequential models; i in and v are characteristics of iterative and incremental models

question: Which of the following is an example of scenario-oriented acceptance criteria?

options.A: The user should be able to provide three inputs to test the product - the AI model to be tested, the data used and an optional text file
options.B: An unregistered user shouldn't be shown any report
options.C: Verify that a registered user can create add a new project with name having more than 100 characters
options.D: A user is already logged in then on navigating to the AI model testing page the user should be directly shown the report of last test run

question: Consider a program that computes the factorial of a number (n). From the specifications you know that:

options.A: There are 3 partitions - one for negative numbers, one for numbers up to 100 and the last one for numbers up to 200
options.B: The requirements are not correct because the partitions are overlapping
options.C: The equivalence partitions cannot be determined for this question because the error message for two partitions is exactly same
options.D: The equivalence partitions cannot be determined for this question because factorial of numbers close to 200 will be very large

question: Which of the following is a good testing practice which is applicable INDEPENDENT of the software development lifecycle followed?

options.A: Not all development activities should have corresponding test activities
options.B: Large amount of redundancy between test levels is good because it prevents bug leakage
options.C: Reviews should be done after the work products have been finalized
options.D: Each test level should have an appropriate test objective

question: Which ONE of the following is a CORRECT example of the purpose of a test plan?

options.A: A test manager decides to create a one-page test plan for an agile project for communicating the broad activities and explaining why detailed test cases will not be written as mandated by the test policy.
options.B: A test plan is a good document to have for the agile projects because it helps the test manager assign tasks to different people.
options.C: A test lead decides to write a detailed test plan so that in future, in case of project failure responsibilities could be assigned to the right person.
options.D: A test manager should always create a very simple test plan because the purpose of test plan is to ensure that there is documentation for the purpose of audits.

question: A software development company invests heavily in tools to support the entire software development lifecycle, including testing. They have a tool that allows automated creation and installation of builds and subsequent execution of various types of automated tests. Which ONE of the following is a CORRECT statement about this type of test tool?

options.A: It is an example of DevOps related tools
options.B: It is an example of collaboration tool
options.C: It is an example of test implementation tool
options.D: It is an example of automated unit testing tool

question: An e-commerce site accepts credit cards for processing the payment. The payment processing form has a field for the amount of money to be deducted. The minimum amount of money that can be processed is $10. The credit cards have a limit of $5,000 (Five Thousand). Assume that only integers can be accepted as inputs. Which of the following set of boundary values you will choose for EFFICIENT testing for the amount of money that can be spent?
Which of the following is the BEST example of whole team approach?

options.A: Anyone can perform a task they are capable of
options.B: Sharing same physical workspace is a must
options.C: Testing is the responsibility of the entire team
options.D: Developers should depend on the business analysts as there is no distinction between testers and developers

question: Which of the following statements is CORRECT?

options.A: Testing based on the structure of the software under test (SUT) is white-box testing whereas testing the input-output behaviour without pre-written test cases is experience based testing.
options.B: Testing the software under test (SUT) based on the design is black-box testing whereas testing the input-output behaviour is experience based testing.
options.C: Testing the software under test (SUT) is possible only after implementation in white-box testing whereas testing the software even before implementation is possible in exploratory testing.
options.D: Testing the software under test (SUT) using knowledge of the tester is experience based testing whereas testing the specification based behaviour without pre-written test cases is using black-box testing techniques.

question: Match the Work Product with the category it belongs to:
Which of the following is the main difference between quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC)?

options.A: QA is the responsibility of everyone on a project while QC is the responsibility of a dedicated team
options.B: QA is a process-oriented approach, while QC is a product-oriented approach.
options.C: QA is preventive while QC is corrective
options.D: QA is focused on implementation, while QC is focused on improvement

question: Shripriya is defining the guidelines for the review process implementation in her company. Which of the following statements is LEAST likely to have been recommended by her?

options.A: Review initiation is the stage when the review team starts the discussion on the review comments
options.B: Independent of the size of the work products, planning for the review should be performed
options.C: Large sized work products should be reviewed in one go because you will have to spend too much time if you split it into multiple reviews
options.D: Defect reports should be created for every review found

question: Which of the following examples represents System Integration testing?

options.A: Testing the system based on specifications using simulator for a sub-system
options.B: Testing an application in development environment which is similar to the production environment
options.C: Testing an application's behaviour to check if it fulfils business needs
options.D: Testing if e-commerce website works correctly with a third-party payment gateway

question: Which of the following statements is CORRECT about error guessing?

options.A: Error guessing depends on the developers guessing what mistakes testers might make and miss the possible defects
options.B: While reviewing the test cases, testers have to make guess about the kind of mistakes test cases might contain
options.C: Error guessing doesn't make use of past failures as past failures are not indicators of correct defects
options.D: Fault attacks are an example of a technique for implementing error guessing

question: Which of the following is LEAST likely to describe a task performed by someone in a testing role?

options.A: Evaluate test basis and test object
options.B: Create test completion report
options.C: Define test environment requirements
options.D: Assess testability of test object

question: Which of the following correctly represents a test first approach?

options.A: Tests are derived from acceptance criteria and run to check that the code passes these tests
options.B: Application behaviour is written in Given/When/Then format and tests are then written and run
options.C: First the tests fail then the code is written to pass the tests and this is iterated
options.D: Code is refactored first then tests are written and run

question: Which ONE of the following statements is correct?

options.A: Static analysis can be used against a work product containing unstructured artifacts
options.B: There may be legal issues in performing static testing on a commercially available executable library
options.C: Difficult to interpret work products are best tested using static analysis
options.D: Test cases can be tested using static testing techniques but not the models

question: A test manager has started a cycle of testing for an e-commerce application. The reason for testing is the change in the protocol for connecting to the payment gateway because of new regulations. Which of the following correctly names this type of testing?

options.A: Beta testing
options.B: Retirement testing
options.C: System integration testing
options.D: Maintenance testing

question: An organization is working on updating test cases for a particular module of their software.

options.A: Incident Management Tool
options.B: Configuration Management Tool
options.C: Backup tool
options.D: Test Execution tool

question: Which of the following statements is CORRECT about White-box testing?

options.A: White-box testing helps find defects because they can be used to measure statement coverage
options.B: White-box testing helps find defects because it focuses on defects rather than failures
options.C: White-box testing helps find defects even when specifications are vague because it takes into account the code
options.D: White-box testing helps find defects because it provides for requirements-based coverage

question: Which of the following types of bug are more likely to be found by static testing then by dynamic testing?

options.A: Variables that were declared in the code without initialization
options.B: Functions that take much longer time to complete than expected
options.C: Crashes of the application
options.D: A sub-system that does not perform the intended functionality

question: A tester created a decision table (DT) given below. While reviewing the DT some of the actions for the given conditions were found to be incorrect. The user is trying to view the profile which of the given conditions has CORRECT action(s) listed?

options.A: C1
options.B: C2
options.C: C3
options.D: C4

question: Which of the following is NOT a typical debugging activity when a failure is triggered by dynamic testing?

options.A: Adding new test cases
options.B: Diagnosing the root cause
options.C: Fixing the cause
options.D: Reproducing the failure

question: An agile software development organization has recently hired a senior tester. The organization has distributed teams spread across time zones. They need to share test status with various stakeholders including upper management and customers at a regular interval. Which of the following statements seems to be correct with regards to the communication?

options.A: Since the stakeholders include upper management, formal reports delivered face-to-face are critical
options.B: Since the stakeholders include customers frequent informal communication without a specific frequency works better
options.C: Distributed nature of teams working in various time zones means email communication will work better.
options.D: Agile nature of the project means very less documentation and hence the status need not be documented and shared in a formal manner

question: Consider the following defect report for an Exam Booking System.

options.A: Repeating the test case with different browsers and logging a separate defect for each one of them.
options.B: The defect Id used is alphanumeric in nature. It should be a number only.
options.C: Providing better severity and priority. It is not clear why this is a high severity problem as the exams can be booked without any problem.
options.D: Providing exact steps that lead to this defect. It is not clear from the description if this is a problem for any scheduled exam or for a specific user.

question: Calculate the measurement error SD for the following estimates done using three-point estimation technique:
Scenario “Big Drop”:

options.A: 5 decision rules
options.B: 6 decision rules
options.C: 32 decision rules
options.D: 8 decision rules

question: Which ONE of the following options is a PRODUCT risk and NOT a PROJECT risk?

options.A: Incorrect calculation logic in the software, leading to inaccurate results.
options.B: Poor communication between team members, making project management more difficult.
options.C: Staff shortages in the project leading to scheduling problems.
options.D: Delays in the delivery of work products by the project team.

question: Consider the following iteration planning tasks where a tester can provide value:

options.A: Determining the test strategy
options.B: Participating in the detailed risk analysis of user stories and determining their testability
options.C: Planning the testing for the release
options.D: Writing testable user stories and acceptance criteria

question: Which ONE of the following options MOST ACCURATELY describes statement testing?

options.A: In statement testing, the coverage items are control flow transfers between branches. The aim is to design test cases to exercise branches in the code until an acceptable level of coverage is achieved, expressed as a percentage.
options.B: In statement testing, the coverage items are decisions and statements. The aim is to design test cases that exercise statements in the code until an acceptable level of coverage is achieved, expressed as a percentage.
options.C: In statement testing, the coverage items are branches, and the aim is to design test cases to exercise branches in the code until an acceptable level of coverage is achieved, expressed as a percentage.
options.D: In statement testing, the coverage items are executable statements. The aim is to design test cases that exercise statements in the code until an acceptable level of coverage is achieved, expressed as a percentage.

question: Scenario “Happy Tomatoes”
Scenario “Happy Tomatoes”

options.A: Identification of the test object and test environment
options.B: A concise title and a short summary of the defect being reported
options.C: Description of the structure of the test team
options.D: Expected results and actual results

question: Scenario “Happy Tomatoes”
Which ONE of the following options CANNOT be subjected to static analysis?

options.A: COTS (Commercial off-the-shelf)
options.B: Source code
options.C: BPMN (Business Process Modeling and Notation) models
options.D: UML (Unified Modeling Language) models

question: Which ONE of the following statements about the objectives of confirmation and regression testing is the BEST?

options.A: The purpose of confirmation testing is to confirm that the defect giving rise to a failure has been successfully fixed. The regression test aims to ensure that no defects have been introduced or discovered in unmodified areas of the software as a result of the changes made.
options.B: The purpose of confirmation testing is to confirm that the defect giving rise to a failure has been satisfactorily fixed. The regression test aims to ensure that no defects have been introduced or discovered in modified areas of the software as a result of the changes made.
options.C: Confirmation testing aims to confirm that the observed failure is not a false positive. The regression test aims to ensure that no defects have been introduced or discovered in unmodified areas of the software as a result of the changes made.
options.D: The purpose of regression testing is to confirm that the defect giving rise to a failure has been satisfactorily resolved. The purpose of the confirmation testing is to ensure that no defects have been introduced or discovered in unmodified areas of the software as a result of the changes made.

question: Consider the following list of possible benefits of retrospectives (A to D):
Which ONE of the following options explains a benefit of independent testing the BEST?

options.A: The testers can be isolated from the development team and thus avoid acquiring the same bias as the developers.
options.B: Independent testers may lack information regarding the test object.
options.C: Independent testers are likely to recognize different types of failures compared to developers.
options.D: Developers may lose a sense of responsibility for the quality of the product they develop.

question: Which ONE of the following options is NOT a test objective?

options.A: Verifying whether specified requirements have been fulfilled
options.B: Triggering failures and finding defects
options.C: Finding errors
options.D: Validating whether the test object is complete and works as expected by the stakeholders

question: Consider the following statements (I to V) about software testing:

options.A: Statements I, III, and IV
options.B: Statements II, IV, and V
options.C: Statements I, II, and IV
options.D: Statements II, III, and V I. Can be applied to non-executable work products.

question: Which ONE of the following options MOST ACCURATELY describes the activities of “testing” and “debugging”?

options.A: Testing triggers a failure that is caused by a defect in the software, whereas debugging is concerned with finding the causes of this failure (defects), analyzing these causes, and eliminating them.
options.B: Testing triggers a failure that is caused by a defect in the software, whereas debugging is concerned with finding the causes of this failure (defects), analyzing these causes, and reproducing them.
options.C: Testing identifies a defect that is caused by an error in the software, whereas debugging is concerned with finding the causes of this defect, analyzing these causes, and eliminating them.
options.D: Testing triggers a defect that is caused by an error in the software, whereas debugging is concerned with finding the causes of this defect, analyzing these causes, and eliminating them.

question: The following state transition diagram describes the behavior of a control system in terms of its possible modes of operation. The initial start state will be the “NORMAL MODE”.

options.A: NORMAL MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE >> DEGRADED MODE >> EMERGENCY MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE >> NORMAL MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE
options.B: NORMAL MODE >> DEGRADED MODE >> NORMAL MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE >> DEGRADED MODE >> EMERGENCY MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE
options.C: NORMAL MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE >> DEGRADED MODE >> EMERGENCY MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE >> NORMAL MODE >> DEGRADED MODE
options.D: NORMAL MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE >> NORMAL MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE >> EMERGENCY MODE >> DIAGNOSTIC MODE >> NORMAL MODE

question: As a result of the joint evaluation of a product version with the customer, it has been concluded that it would be appropriate to retrieve an earlier version of the product and carry out a benchmark. Depending on the result, further development will be carried out based on the current version or the retrieved version.

options.A: Defect management
options.B: Configuration management
options.C: Change management
options.D: Risk management

question: Which ONE of the following tools would be MOST SUITABLE for facilitating the creation of test cases, test data, and test procedures?

options.A: Test design and implementation tools are specifically designed for creating test cases, test data, and test procedures.
options.B: Static testing tools as they assist the tester in conducting reviews and static analysis.
options.C: DevOps tools, as they support the automated build process and CI/C
options.D: Test execution and coverage tools facilitate the automated execution of tests and the measurement of test coverage.

question: Your organization's test strategy states that it is desirable to use more than one method for estimating the test effort. You are responsible for establishing the test effort for the next project. Based on historical information, the type of project you are going to estimate has a development-to-test effort ratio of 5:3.

options.A: 750 person-days
options.B: 180 person-days
options.C: 720 person-days
options.D: 270 person-days

question: User Story:

options.A: Acceptance criteria 8 has not been fully covered during the above test cycle.
options.B: Acceptance criteria 4 has not been fully covered during the above test cycle.
options.C: All acceptance criteria have been fully covered during the above test cycle.
options.D: Acceptance criteria 6 has not been fully covered during the above test cycle.

question: Which ONE of the following activities TYPICALLY belongs to the planning phase of the review process?

options.A: A separate defect report is created for each identified defect so that corrective actions can be tracked.
options.B: Each reviewer conducts an individual review to identify anomalies, recommendations, and questions.
options.C: The purpose and scope of the review are defined, as well as the work product to be reviewed and the exit criteria.
options.D: The reviewers analyze and discuss the anomalies found during the review in a joint meeting.

question: Which ONE of the following options is a practice that does NOT TYPICALLY correspond to a shift left approach?

options.A: Reviewing the specification from the perspective of testing.
options.B: Write the test cases before writing the code and run the code in a test harness during code implementation.
options.C: Using continuous integration (CI) and even better continuous delivery (CD).
options.D: Performing non-functional testing starting at the system test level.

question: Consider the following list of activities (I to V):

options.A: Activities III, IV, and V
options.B: Activities II and V
options.C: Activities I and V
options.D: Activities I, III, and IV I. Test design

question: Which ONE of the following options CORRECTLY describes one of the seven principles of the testing process?

options.A: The objective of testing is to implement exhaustive testing and execute as many test cases as possible.
options.B: Exhaustive testing can only be carried out using behavior-based techniques.
options.C: It is impossible to test all possible combinations of inputs and preconditions of a system.
options.D: Automated testing enables exhaustive testing.

question: Consider the following table, which contains information about test cases from the test management system:
Which ONE of the following work products TYPICALLY belongs to test execution?

options.A: Test logs that document the results of test execution.
options.B: Automated test scripts used for test execution.
options.C: A test plan that describes the test strategy and test objectives.
options.D: A list of test conditions prioritized during test analysis.

question: Which ONE of the following statements would you expect to be the MOST DIRECT advantage of the whole-team approach?

options.A: Capitalizing on the combined skills of business representatives, testers, and developers working together to contribute to project success.
options.B: Reducing the involvement of business representatives because of enhanced communication and collaboration between testers and developers.
options.C: Avoiding requirements misunderstandings that may not have been detected until dynamic testing when they are more expensive to fix.
options.D: Having an automated build and test process, at least once a day, that detects integration errors early and quickly.

question: Which ONE of the following roles is responsible for mediating, managing time, and generating a safe review environment in which everyone can speak freely?

options.A: Manager
options.B: Reviewer
options.C: Review leader
options.D: Moderator

question: Which ONE of the following elements is TYPICALLY used to guide testing during exploratory testing?

options.A: A test charter that defines the testing objectives for the test session.
options.B: A comprehensive specification that must be fully available before testing begins.
options.C: A detailed test script that prescribes all the steps to be performed.
options.D: A predefined test case that must be executed exactly as documented.

question: Which ONE of the following statements BEST applies checklist-based testing?

options.A: Checklists should contain general guidelines to ensure that all aspects of the software are covered.
options.B: Checklists should contain specific test conditions that can be individually and directly checked.
options.C: Checklists should primarily consist of automated test cases to maximize efficiency.
options.D: Checklists should be used exclusively for functional testing, as they are unsuitable for non-functional testing.

question: Which ONE of the following options corresponds to an activity in the testing process in which testable features are identified?

options.A: Test design
options.B: Test analysis
options.C: Test implementation
options.D: Test execution

question: Which ONE of the following options MOST ACCURATELY describes branch testing?

options.A: In branch testing, the coverage items are executable statements. The aim is to design test cases that exercise statements in the code until an acceptable level of coverage is achieved, expressed as a percentage.
options.B: In branch testing, the coverage items are control flow transfers between decisions, and the aim is to design test cases to exercise flow transfers in the code until an acceptable level of coverage is achieved. Coverage is measured as the number of branches exercised by the test cases divided by the total number of branches expressed as a percentage.
options.C: In branch testing, the coverage items are branches, and the aim is to design test cases to exercise branches in the code until an acceptable level of coverage is achieved. Coverage is measured as the number of branches exercised by the test cases divided by the total number of branches expressed as a percentage.
options.D: In branch testing, the coverage items are executable decisions. The aim is to design test cases that exercise statements in the code until an acceptable level of coverage is achieved. Coverage is expressed as a percentage.

question: Which ONE of the following is a GOOD testing practice that is INDEPENDENT of the chosen SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) model?

options.A: Testers are involved in reviewing work products as soon as the final version of this documentation is available so that this earlier testing and defect detection can support the “shift-left” strategy.
options.B: Test analysis and design for a specific test level begin during the corresponding development phase of the SDLC, allowing testing to follow the principle of late testing.
options.C: For every software development activity, there is a corresponding testing activity, ensuring that all development activities are subject to quality assurance.
options.D: Different test levels have specific and overlapping test objectives, allowing tests to be appropriate to specific test object types while managing redundancy.

question: Which ONE of the following options is NOT a benefit of test automation?

options.A: Reduced test execution times
options.B: More objective assessment
options.C: Prevention of simple human errors
options.D: Eliminating completely the need for manual testing

question: Which ONE of the following elements is TYPICALLY NOT part of a test progress report?

options.A: Obstacles and their workarounds
options.B: A detailed assessment of product quality
options.C: Test metrics to show the current status of the test process
options.D: New or changed risks

question: Consider the following statements about acceptance test levels (I to V):

options.A: Statements I, III, and V
options.B: Statements II, IV, and V
options.C: Statements II and V
options.D: Statements I and IV I. Acceptance test levels focus on validating and demonstrating readiness for deployment.

question: Which ONE of the following options BEST characterizes the Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) approach?

options.A: Expresses the desired behavior of an application with test cases written in a simple form of natural language that is easy to understand by stakeholders — usually using the Preconditions/Input Values/Process/Output Values/Postconditions format. Test cases are then automatically translated into executable tests.
options.B: Expresses the desired behavior of an application with test cases written in a simple form of natural language that is easy to understand by stakeholders — usually using the Given/When/Then format. Test cases are then automatically translated into executable tests.
options.C: Derives tests from acceptance criteria as part of the system design process. Tests are written before the part of the application is developed to satisfy the tests. Tests will persist as automated tests to ensure code maintainability in future adaptions/refactoring.
options.D: Derives tests from acceptance criteria as part of the system design process. Tests are written before the part of the application is developed to satisfy the tests. Tests may persist as automated tests to ensure the code quality in future adaptions/refactoring.

question: Which ONE of the following elements is TYPICALLY part of the test plan?

options.A: The budget and schedule for the test project.
options.B: A detailed analysis of the defects found and their causes.
options.C: A detailed report on the test results after the test project is completed.
options.D: A list of test logs from the test execution.

question: Which ONE of the following options identifies the perspectives through which a collective authorship process generates a shared vision of user stories?

options.A: Product owner, development, and testing
options.B: Business, architecture, and testing
options.C: Business, development, and testing
options.D: Business, development, and acceptance testing

question: Which ONE of the following options BEST describes the third test quadrant (3)?

options.A: This test quadrant contains smoke tests and non-functional tests (except usability tests). These tests are often automated.
options.B: This test quadrant is business-facing and criticizes the system. It contains exploratory testing, usability testing, and user acceptance testing.
options.C: This test quadrant contains functional tests, examples, user story tests, user experience prototypes, API testing, and simulations. These tests check the acceptance criteria and can be manual or automated.
options.D: This test quadrant is technology-facing and supports the team. These tests should be automated and included in the continuous integration (CI) process.

question: Which ONE of the following options BEST describes black-box test techniques?

options.A: Black-Box testing techniques are based on experience with the test object without knowing the internal structure.
options.B: In Black-Box testing techniques, test cases are created based on the software's implementation.
options.C: Black-box testing techniques are based on analyzing the test object's specified and implied behavior without knowledge of its internal data structure.
options.D: Black-box testing techniques involve analyzing the specified behavior of the test object without knowledge of its internal structure.

question: Which of the following is a typical test objective?

options.A: To fix defects efficiently and effectively
options.B: To ensure the software is free of defects
options.C: To verify that the software meets specified requirements
options.D: To confirm that all possible input combinations have been tested

question: Consider two situations:

options.A: Both (1) and (2) are defects
options.B: (1) is an error, (2) is a failure
options.C: (1) is a defect, (2) is a failure
options.D: Both (1) and (2) are errors

question: The Pareto principle states that a few causes are responsible for most effects.

options.A: Exhaustive testing is impossible
options.B: Tests wear out
options.C: Defects cluster together
options.D: Early testing saves time and money

question: Match test activities (1)-(4) with related tasks (P)-(S):
Which of the following is a testware created during test analysis?

options.A: “Steps: 1) enter valid username; 2) enter a correct password; 3) click “Login”; expected result: the user is logged”
options.B: “Check that the user can successfully log in to the application with valid credentials”
options.C: “Number of test cases run: 55; number of test cases passed: 35; number of test cases failed: 20”
options.D: “When a user enters valid credentials and clicks the “Login” button, no action occurs, and the user remains on the login page”

question: How can a tester use traceability?

options.A: To calculate requirements coverage after test execution
options.B: To derive test data that meet the specified coverage criteria
options.C: To analyze the test execution log to detect possible root causes
options.D: To ensure consistency and control across IT environments

question: Which approach BEST improves team dynamics, enhances communication, and creates synergy by allowing the various skill sets within the team to be leveraged for the benefit of the project?

options.A: Collaboration-based test approach
