options.B: Whole team approach
options.C: Exploratory testing
options.D: Test-first approach

question: A developer assumed users would always filter items by category to narrow their search. However, a tester conducted usability testing and found that most users prefer using the search bar instead, highlighting a potential gap in the user interface design.

options.A: Shift left
options.B: Independence of testing
options.C: Confirmation testing
options.D: Retrospectives

question: Which practice should be applied to ALL software development lifecycles?

options.A: Test activities should be planned for each iteration separately
options.B: Test design for a given test level should begin just after the implementation is done
options.C: All test levels should have the same specific test objectives
options.D: Each development activity should have a corresponding test activity

question: Which of the following is NOT an example of a test-first approach to development?

options.A: Acceptance Test-Driven Development
options.B: Test Coverage-Driven Development
options.C: Behavior-Driven Development
options.D: Test-Driven Development

question: Which of the following is an example of a shift left?

options.A: Performing non-functional testing using functional test cases
options.B: Monitoring system performance after the release
options.C: Using Acceptance Test-Driven Development
options.D: Participating in retrospectives

question: Which of the following is an example of how retrospectives can be used for process improvement?

options.A: Retrospectives lead to increased project budget
options.B: Retrospectives allow for a quick resolution of technical debt
options.C: Retrospectives improve the quality of the test basis
options.D: Retrospectives facilitate discussions about new product features

question: What is the difference between confirmation testing and regression testing?

options.A: Confirmation testing verifies that specific defects have been fixed, while regression testing ensures that recent changes have not introduced new defects in existing functionality.
options.B: Confirmation testing is performed by developers as unit or unit integration testing, while regression testing is performed by testers as system integration, system, or acceptance testing.
options.C: There is no difference. These two terms are synonymous.
options.D: Confirmation testing verifies that the test object works correctly under expected conditions, while regression testing verifies the system's robustness with unexpected or incorrect data.

question: What kind of work products can be examined by reviews?

options.A: Only work products with a structure against which they can be checked by a tool
options.B: Only work products that can be read and understood
options.C: Only work products that are difficult to interpret by humans
options.D: Only non-executable work products

question: Which of the following statements about static and dynamic testing is TRUE?

options.A: Static testing can detect that a component has too many lines of code; dynamic testing can force a component to return the wrong result
options.B: Static testing can force a component to return the wrong result; dynamic testing can force a component to return the correct result
options.C: Static testing can demonstrate that software fails when given specific input data; dynamic testing finds defects directly
options.D: Static testing can be performed at all test levels; dynamic testing can be performed only at system, system integration, and acceptance test levels

question: Which role is responsible for ensuring the effective running of review meetings?

options.A: Review leader
options.B: Facilitator
options.C: Scribe
options.D: Manager

question: The development team is finalizing the design of a database schema for a banking application. Before implementation, architects want to get a consensus among team members on the details of this scheme.

options.A: Informal review
options.B: Technical review
options.C: Inspection
options.D: Static analysis

question: Consider the following characteristics of test techniques.

options.A: (iii), (v) - black-box; (ii), (iv) - white-box; (i) - experience-based
options.B: (ii), (iv) - black-box; (i), (v) - white-box; (iii) - experience-based
options.C: (i) - black-box; (ii), (iii) - white-box; (iv), (v) - experience-based
options.D: (i), (iii) - black-box; (ii) - white-box; (iv), (v) - experience-based

question: You validate the correctness of price calculation in a food ordering application. The input parameter is the order amount (in $), and the result is the final price reflecting the discount. If the order amount is less than $100, the discount is not granted (0% discount). If the order amount is greater than $500, a 50% discount is granted. In other cases, the 10% discount is granted.

The temperature controller receives the temperature in full degrees Celsius (°C) as input. For 0 degrees, it returns the message ‘zero temperature’. For positive temperatures, it returns the message ‘positive temperature’. For negative temperatures, it returns the message ‘negative temperature’.
You test a system that grants a driving license. You design test cases based on the following minimized decision table.

options.A: No test case is needed; the existing test cases already achieve the required coverage
options.B: 17 years old, passed both vision and driving test; expected result: grant a license
options.C: 18 years old, passed vision test, failed driving test; expected result: do not grant a license
options.D: 20 years old failed vision test passed driving test-expected result: do not grant a license

question: You work on a project where the executed test set achieved 100% statement coverage.

options.A: Each executable statement with a defect had to be exercised at least once
options.B: The test set triggered no failures in the tested code
options.C: All requirements related to the code under test are met
options.D: Each decision outcome in the code had to be evaluated both for true and false

question: If:

options.A: ЕС/С + EU/U
options.B: (EC+EU) / (C+U)
options.C: EC/С
options.D: EC + EU

question: What is error guessing?

options.A: A test technique in which the tester anticipates the mistakes the developer might make, defects they might introduce, and failures that may occur due to these defects
options.B: A test technique in which a tester designs, implements, and executes tests to cover test conditions from a checklist built based on knowledge about how software fails
options.C: A test estimation technique in which testers use their knowledge and experience to estimate the effort needed to fix problems in the test process due to testers’ mistakes
options.D: A type of software testing that identifies vulnerabilities, threats, and risks in a system to ensure its resources are protected from unauthorized access and malicious attacks

question: Which of the following is TRUE about exploratory testing?

options.A: It is more effective when a tester is less experienced and has no domain knowledge
options.B: It uses test results to learn more about the test object and create more focused tests
options.C: It allows the use of experience-based test techniques but not black-box test techniques
options.D: It focuses not only on defect detection but also on defect avoidance through collaboration

question: Consider the following two versions of acceptance criteria for a user story: “As a registered user, I want to be able to change my user’s name to update my personal data”

options.A: Both variants use a scenario-oriented format
options.B: Both variants use a rule-oriented format
options.C: Variant 1 is rule-oriented; Variant 2 is scenario-oriented
options.D: Variant 1 is scenario-oriented; Variant 2 is rule-oriented

question: Which TWO are the examples of entry criteria for system testing of a food order app? (Choose two.)

options.A: All functional tests for the payment process are automated
options.B: A test basis describing the business rules for discounts is available
options.C: All smoke tests of the registering and logging features passed
options.D: The appropriate functional tests cover all use cases E. There are no critical and at most 3 major defects unresolved

question: Your team is developing a new functionality for an employee management system, a Simple Reporting feature. The team is tasked with estimating the test effort required to test this feature.

options.A: 4 hours
options.B: 2 hours
options.C: 3 hours
options.D: 6 hours

question: You prioritize test cases using the additional coverage prioritization technique, using the requirements coverage as a coverage measure. All four test cases must be executed. The coverage achieved by your test cases is shown in the table below.

options.A: TC1
options.B: TC2
options.C: TC3
options.D: TC4

question: In the testing quadrants model, which testing is business-facing and supports the team?

options.A: Security testing
options.B: Component testing
options.C: API testing
options.D: Exploratory testing

question: What does the risk level depend on?

options.A: Risk impact and risk likelihood
options.B: Risk likelihood and risk priority
options.C: Risk impact and risk severity
options.D: Risk priority and risk severity

question: Categorize these risks into project risks and product risks.

options.A: (i), (ii), and (iv) are product risks; (iii) and (v) are project risks
options.B: (ii) and (v) are product risks; (i), (iii), and (iv) are project risks
options.C: (iii) and (v) are product risks; (i), (ii), and (iv) are project risks
options.D: (iii) and (iv) are product risks; (i), (ii) and (v) are project risks

question: Which type of report will MOST LIKELY contain information about testing planned for the next period?

options.A: Test progress report
options.B: Defect report
options.C: Test completion report
options.D: Risk register

question: The customer reported the software failure in the form of a defect report, providing the version number of the software they use. Based on this information, the team identified the files used to build this version and the elements of the environment in which this version was created. This made it possible to identify and fix the defect quickly.

options.A: Defect management
options.B: Configuration management
options.C: Test automation
options.D: Test estimation

question: You prepared the following defect report.

options.A: Add expected results after each step in the “steps to reproduce” section
options.B: Add environment data and link to the test case that caused the failure
options.C: Reduce severity and priority levels
options.D: Add a suggestion how a source code could he chanced to fix the underlying defect

question: Which tools support delivery pipelines, automated build processes, and practices such as Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery?

options.A: Collaboration tools
options.B: Test design and test implementation tools
options.C: Test management tools
options.D: DevOps tools

question: Which of the following BEST illustrates the benefit of using test coverage tools?

options.A: Ease of configuration management
options.B: More objective assessment
options.C: Better defect prevention
options.D: Dependency on tool vendor
